Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2010 03:26PM getwell wrote: Sorry you are going through such a terribly hard time. Most of us here have also been through horrific treatments so we know pretty much how you feel. After my first chemo round I was so sick that I told my husband I would not go back for more treatment. I would rather die. He called my onc and they gave me a bunch of meds and most importantly I went for hydration 2 days in a row. That made a big difference. The whole thing sucked but I did get through it and I am still here fighting the beast. Talking to other people who had been through chemo helped me, too. If you want to call just PM me and I will give you my number. Pat

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2008 07:38PM getwell wrote: Dear Lynn,       Sorry you have joined this club. You definitely need to find a new doctor. I was just dx'd with bone mets  in 3 spots. The one on my spine was bothering me so I had radiation. I don't feel the other 2 bc they are small. I asked my doc straight out if I was dying and she said absolutley not. Bone mets are not cureable but they are treatable. I just started Faslodex and will start Zometa in 2 months which will be one month from the day I finish my dental treatment, My onc doesn't want to take an unnecessary chances with the jaw necrosis thing. Hey, it sucks, but we do still have some options and life to live. One day  at a time is my mantra. HUGS< Pat

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2008 12:26AM getwell wrote: Hi Suzi,       I bought my wig before my hair fell out and got one that looked very much like my own hair. It was a mistake. A few monthe later I tried on a blonde (I am a brunette) in a completely different style and I loved it. Many people actually asked me where I got my haircut. Boy that felt good!! Also, my insurance paid the entire cost ($500.00) The first person I asked at the ins. co said no but when I asked to speak to a supervisor she said they did cover wigs (prothesis) for chemo patients.  Good luck my friend.

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2010 08:03PM getwell wrote: It ain't always cancer. A few months ago I had severe pain in my ribs which I thought for sure as the big C. No. It was some pulled muscles. Just 2 weeks ago I must have lifted something a bit too heavy and I had such pain in my neck/shoulder. I had xrays done and again I had pulled a muscle. Please keep that in mind, Try to keep calm with the aid of some anti-anxiety meds and see your doc  ASAP so you don't drive yourself crazy. I know the anxiety of not knowing is the worst. _Please let me know how you are doing. If you want PM me and I will give you my tel number. HUGZ, Pat
